notesStmt.note: An image of the verso of the second leaf is not currently available. The verso is presumably blank.

revisionDesc.change: added note about missing verso leaf
merged files with proofreading changes and earlier checked version
Duke proofreading corrections and minor note corrections.
Proofreading Corrections: Heyde dates and Silent Proof
Moved RMBucke to HandNote; fixed editor, date, and title; reviewed paragraphing
Replaced smart quotes with straight; removed external URL links.
Annotated date to explain high level of certainty is 1867; made proofreading corrections.
Corrected annotation for nickname California for Jessie Louisa.

body.p:
it is saturday Saturday afternoon and martha is gone away and hattie and julia levy has gone to take a walk and california and Eddy is the only company i have at present and there seemes seemes to be A lull in the confusion so I thought I would take the chance to write A few lines to say I received your letter on wensday Wednesday and the money all safe so on the strenght strength of the 5 dollars I went down town for the first time sinc since I have been up here I felt quite strange george gave me A great charge to be carefull careful I thought I
should go and see aunt becca but it got so late I dident didn't go while I was waiting for the car who should I see but georgee he had been to court he was suppeaned— subpoenaed— something about some work that the parties couldent couldn't agree so he put me in the car and i was glad to get out of the bustle I have lived in the country so long it seemed quite strange i suppose Walt you have got my letter Jeff was gone away and i sent it by davis if you have not got it the 10 dollar came all safe and the envelopes envelopes you will be home wont won't you Walt in July you
must try too to come as soon as that if you can) george talks about our house quite strong and you may depend i dont don't loose lose an opportunaty opportunity to put in a few words in favor of it carpenters gets 4 do dollars per day and plasterers 6 dos dollars wonderfull wonderful wages aint ain't it i must stop writing as Edd is waiting to take the letter i am about the same some days i dont don't feel very well then again i feel quite spry my wrist keeps lame yet
